@prsunny we validated this on 202205.  So this can be merged to 202205.

The failure isn't caused by the PR itself.
```

/azp run Azure.sonic-swss
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).
@yxieca @prsunny Can you please help merging this?

Without the fix the test case fails with the following error message, which is expected
```
root@r-sonic-vs-021:~/sonic-swss/tests# pytest test_sub_port_intf.py -k test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change  --dvsname=gracious_jepsen
========================================================================================================== test session starts ==========================================================================================================
platform linux -- Python 3.8.10, pytest-4.6.2, py-1.10.0, pluggy-0.13.1
rootdir: /root/sonic-swss/tests
plugins: flaky-3.7.0
collected 10 items / 9 deselected / 1 selected                                                                                                                                                                                          

test_sub_port_intf.py F                                                                                                                                                                                                           [100%]

=============================================================================================================== FAILURES ================================================================================================================
________________________________________________________________________________________ TestSubPortIntf.test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change _________________________________________________________________________________________

self = <test_sub_port_intf.TestSubPortIntf object at 0x7fad2aaaf370>, dvs = <conftest.DockerVirtualSwitch object at 0x7fad2aaaf400>

    def test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change(self, dvs):
        self.connect_dbs(dvs)
    
        #self._test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change(dvs, self.SUB_PORT_INTERFACE_UNDER_TEST)
>       self._test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change(dvs, self.LAG_SUB_PORT_INTERFACE_UNDER_TEST, defer_parent_adminup=True)

test_sub_port_intf.py:886: 
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
test_sub_port_intf.py:802: in _test_sub_port_intf_admin_status_change
    self.check_sub_port_intf_fvs(self.app_db, APP_INTF_TABLE_NAME, sub_port_intf_name, fv_dict)
test_sub_port_intf.py:427: in check_sub_port_intf_fvs
    db.wait_for_field_match(table_name, key, fv_dict)
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

self = <dvslib.dvs_database.DVSDatabase object at 0x7fad2aa20070>, table_name = 'INTF_TABLE', key = 'PortChannel1.20', expected_fields = {'admin_status': 'up'}
polling_config = PollingConfig(polling_interval=0.01, timeout=20.0, strict=True), failure_message = None

    def wait_for_field_match(
        self,
        table_name: str,
        key: str,
        expected_fields: Dict[str, str],
        polling_config: PollingConfig = PollingConfig(),
        failure_message: str = None,
    ) -> Dict[str, str]:
        """Wait for the entry stored at `key` to have the specified field/values and retrieve it.
    
        This method is useful if you only care about the contents of a subset of the fields stored
        in the specified entry.
    
        Args:
            table_name: The name of the table where the entry is stored.
            key: The key that maps to the entry being checked.
            expected_fields: The fields and their values we expect to see in the entry.
            polling_config: The parameters to use to poll the db.
            failure_message: The message to print if the call times out. This will only take effect
                if the PollingConfig is set to strict.
    
        Returns:
            The entry stored at `key`. If no entry is found, then an empty Dict is returned.
        """
    
        def access_function():
            fv_pairs = self.get_entry(table_name, key)
            return (
                all(fv_pairs.get(k) == v for k, v in expected_fields.items()),
                fv_pairs,
            )
    
        status, result = wait_for_result(
            access_function, self._disable_strict_polling(polling_config)
        )
    
        if not status:
            message = failure_message or (
                f"Expected field/value pairs not found: expected={expected_fields}, "
                f'received={result}, key="{key}", table="{table_name}"'
            )
>           assert not polling_config.strict, message
E           AssertionError: Expected field/value pairs not found: expected={'admin_status': 'up'}, received={'vlan': '20', 'mtu': '0', '': '', 'admin_status': 'down', 'mac_addr': '00:00:00:00:00:00'}, key="PortChannel1.20", table="INTF_TABLE"

dvslib/dvs_database.py:232: AssertionError
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Captured stdout setup ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
remove extra link dummy
remove extra link PortChannel1
remove extra link PortChannel1.20@PortChannel1
================================================================================================ 1 failed, 9 deselected in 98.43 seconds ================================================================================================
```

> polling_config = PollingConfig(polling_interval=0.01, timeout=20.0, strict=True), failure_message = None
> 
>     def wait_for_field_match(
>         self,
>         table_name: str,

>         expected_fields: Dict[str, str],
>         polling_config: PollingConfig = PollingConfig(),
>         failure_message: str = None,
>     ) -> Dict[str, str]:
>         """Wait for the entry stored at `key` to have the specified field/values and retrieve it.
>     
>         This method is useful if you only care about the contents of a subset of the fields stored
>         in the specified entry.
>     
>         Args:
>             table_name: The name of the table where the entry is stored.
>             key: The key that maps to the entry being checked.
>             expected_fields: The fields and their values we expect to see in the entry.
>             polling_config: The parameters to use to poll the db.
>             failure_message: The message to print if the call times out. This will only take effect
>                 if the PollingConfig is set to strict.
>     
>         Returns:
>             The entry stored at `key`. If no entry is found, then an empty Dict is returned.
>         """
>     
>         def access_function():
>             fv_pairs = self.get_entry(table_name, key)
>             return (
>                 all(fv_pairs.get(k) == v for k, v in expected_fields.items()),
>                 fv_pairs,

> E           AssertionError: Expected field/value pairs not found: expected={'admin_status': 'up'}, received={'vlan': '20', 'mtu': '0', '': '', 'admin_status': 'down', 'mac_addr': '00:00:00:00:00:00'}, key="PortChannel1.20", table="INTF_TABLE"

Thank you for adding this
Please raise a PR for 202012
